sen.j: 九鬼 隆季（くき たかすえ、慶長13年（1608年） - 延宝6年5月30日 (旧暦)（1678年7月18日））は、丹波国綾部藩の初代藩主。
sen.e: Takasue KUKI (1608 - Jul.18, 1678) was the first lord of Ayabe Domain in Tanba Province.
Takasue KUKI (1608 - Jul.18, 1678) was the first lord of Ayabe Domain in Tanba Province.
Takasue KUKI (1608 - Jul.18, 1678) was the first lord of Ayabe Domain in Tanba Province.

sen.j: 志摩国鳥羽藩主・九鬼守隆の三男。
sen.e: He was the third son of Moritaka KUKI, who was the lord of Toba domain of the Province of Shima.
He was the third son of Moritaka KUKI, who was the lord of Toba domain of the Province of Shima.
He was the third son of Moritaka KUKI, who was the lord of Toba domain of the Province of Shima.

sen.j: 織田信長に水軍の将として仕えた事で有名な九鬼嘉隆の孫。
sen.e: He was also a grandson of Yoshitaka KUKI, who was famous for serving Nobunaga ODA as a commander of his Suigun (warriors battle in the sea).
He was also a grandson of Yoshitaka KUKI, who was famous for serving Nobunaga ODA as a commander of his Suigun (warriors battle in the sea).
He was also a grandson of Yoshitaka KUKI, who was famous for serving Nobunaga ODA as a commander of his Suigun (warriors battle in the sea).
His lawful wife was a daughter of Katsushige HIJIKATA.
His lawful wife was a daughter of Katsushige HIJIKATA.
His lawful wife was a daughter of Katsushige HIJIKATA.
His second wife was a daughter of Masanari INOUE.
His second wife was a daughter of Masanari INOUE.
His second wife was a daughter of Masanari INOUE.

sen.j: 子は九鬼隆常（長男）、娘（三枝守輝正室）、娘（秋田季久正室）。
sen.e: He had a son, Takatsune KUKI (the eldest child), and two daughters (one was later to become a lawful wife of Moriteru SAEGUSA and the other was later to become a lawful wife of Suehisa AKITA).
He had a son, Takatsune KUKI (the eldest child), and two daughters (one was later to become a lawful wife of Moriteru SAEGUSA and the other was later to become a lawful wife of Suehisa AKITA).
He had a son, Takatsune KUKI (the eldest child), and two daughters (one was later to become a lawful wife of Moriteru SAEGUSA and the other was later to become a lawful wife of Suehisa AKITA).
His official court rank was Jugoinoge (Junior Fifth Rank, Lower Grade).
His official court rank was Jugoinoge (Junior Fifth Rank, Lower Grade).
His official court rank was Jugoinoge (Junior Fifth Rank, Lower Grade).
His duty was Shikibu shoyu (Junior Assistant of the Ministry of Ceremonial).
His duty was Shikibu shoyu (Junior Assistant of the Ministry of Ceremonial).
His duty was Shikibu shoyu (Junior Assistant of the Ministry of Ceremonial).

sen.j: 父の死後、志摩鳥羽藩の家督をめぐって弟の九鬼久隆と争った。
sen.e: After his father's death, he disputed with his brother, Hisataka KUKI, over the succession of the Toba Domain in the Shima Province.
sen.cmt: 一原文一訳文の例外対処
sen.e: After his father's death, he disputed with his brother, Hisataka KUKI, over the succession of the Toba Domain in the Shima Province.
After his father's death, he disputed with his brother, Hisataka KUKI, over the succession of the Toba Domain in the Shima Province.

sen.j: そのため、寛永10年（1633年）3月に丹波綾部に移されて綾部藩を立藩した。
sen.e: As a result, he was transferred to Ayabe in the Tanba Province where he founded the Ayabe Domain.
sen.cmt: 一原文一訳文の例外対処
sen.e: As a result, he was transferred to Ayabe in the Tanba Province where he founded the Ayabe Domain.
As a result, he was transferred to Ayabe in the Tanba Province where he founded the Ayabe Domain.

sen.j: 寛永19年（1642年）12月30日、式部少輔に叙任。
sen.e: On December 30, 1642, he was appointed as Shikibu shoyu.
On February 18, 1643, he was appointed as Shikibu shoyu.
On February 18, 1643, he was appointed as Shikibu shoyu.

sen.j: 寛文元年（1661年）3月28日、弟の九鬼隆重に500石を分与。
sen.e: On March 28, 1661, he apportioned his fief yielding 500 koku (a unit of volume: rice 1-koku is 180.39 liter) to his younger brother, Takashige KUKI.
sen.cmt: 一原文一訳文の例外対処
sen.e: On April 27, 1661, he apportioned his fief yielding 500 koku (a unit of volume: rice 1-koku is 180.39 liter) to his younger brother, Takashige KUKI.
On April 27, 1661, he apportioned his fief yielding 500 koku (a unit of volume: rice 1-koku is 180.39 liter) to his younger brother, Takashige KUKI.

sen.j: その結果、1万9500石となった。
sen.e: As a result, the fief yielding 19,500 koku was left to him.
sen.cmt: 一原文一訳文の例外対処
sen.e: As a result, the fief yielding 19,500 koku was left to him.
As a result, the fief yielding 19,500 koku was left to him.

sen.j: 隆季は藩政においては、城下町の建設などに尽力している。
sen.e: In his administration of the domain, he devoted himself to such things as building the castle town.
In his administration of the domain, he devoted himself to such things as building the castle town.
In his administration of the domain, he devoted himself to such things as building the castle town.

sen.j: 延宝2年（1674年）11月16日、家督を長男の隆常に譲って隠居した。
sen.e: On November 16, 1674, he retired, entrusting the family estate to his son, Takatsune.
On December 13, 1674, he retired, entrusting the family estate to his son, Takatsune.
On December 13, 1674, he retired, entrusting the family estate to his son, Takatsune.

sen.j: 延宝6年（1678年）5月30日、71歳で死去。
sen.e: On May 30, 1678, he died at the age of 71.
On July 18, 1678, he died at the age of 71.
On July 18, 1678, he died at the age of 71.
His hogo (a Buddhist name) was Kuzan Yohon Taikyokuin.
sen.cmt: 空山了本大極院の読み方不明です。
sen.e: His hogo (a Buddhist name) was Kuzan Yohon Taikyokuin.
sen.cmt: 空山了本大極院の読み方が不明です。
sen.e: His hogo (a Buddhist name) was Kuzan Yohon Taikyokuin.
